results.title: Kikujiro
results.creator_credit: Takeshi Kitano, Takio Yoshida, Masayuki Mori, Nippon Herald Films, Bandai Visual Company and Office Kitano
results.brief_description: Kikujiro, a lazy small time gangster, agrees to take a lonely boy who lives with his grandmother on a road trip during the summer holidays. The two set off to find the boy’s mother who he has never met. Over the course of the return journey the pair meet up with a range of eccentric characters who engage in a series of absurd games and exchanges. While Kitano’s deadpan comic character with a tendency to extreme and sudden violence is familiar from his earlier work, ‘Kikujiro’ marks a departure from the milieu of the criminal underworld to focus on the unlikely bond that gradually develops between the man and boy. The film evokes Chaplin’s ‘The Kid’, both in Kitano’s trademark use of visual gags and in its sentimental bittersweet tone. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast includes Takeshi Kitano, Yusuke Sekiguchi and Kayoko Kishimoto.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: red hot rhythm
results.brief_description: Animated film presenting Kiko the kangaroo. The orchestra in a broadcasting studio is playing red hot rhythm music. However the music is so hot that it actually sets the building alight. Kiko and his firemen come to the rescue to put out the fire.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: Kiko at the bat = Play ball
results.creator_credit: Mannie Davis, Paul Terry and Terry Toons
results.brief_description: It’s the day of the much anticipated ball-game between Kiko’s Australian Champs and the Jungle Giants. The battle begins and the advantage shifts from team to team until fortune smiles upon the Champs and honesty is rewarded with victory.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: hail the king
results.creator_credit: George Gordon, Mannie Davis, Paul Terry, Terrytoons and Castle Films
results.brief_description: Kiko cooks a chicken for the king who has just been coronated but unfortunately the king disapproves and Kiko is sent off to the tower as punishment. Or is this all just a dream! No dialogue - music soundtrack only.

results.title:
Kiki and Kitty
Kitty (Elaine Crombie) costume
results.material_description: polyester, sequins, turkey feathers, Haus of Dizzy gold mirror earrings
results.brief_description: In Kiki and Kitty (2017), Kitty (Elaine Crombie) is Kiki’s (Nakkiah Lui) fairy god-vagina, who shimmers in this sensual, sequined ensemble to embody all the repressed sass and sauciness of Lui’s buttoned-down lawyer.

results.title: Kiki and Kitty
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Kiki and Kitty
results.brief_description: Kiki and Kitty follows the adventures of a young, black woman in a big, white world, where her vagina is a big, black woman AND her best friend.

constellations_other.name: Aboriginal History Archive
constellations_other.description: The Aboriginal History Archive at Victoria University, led by Gary Foley, is dedicated to the collection and preservation of First Peoples' stories and cultural material. The political activism of the Black Power movement in the 1970s is intersected with representation of Aboriginal actors on screen.

constellations_other.name: Sequins and sapphires
constellations_other.description: Two of the most striking costumes on the big and small screens embody the glamour of leading First Peoples ladies.

constellations_other.name: Laughing in the face of adversity
constellations_other.description: Comedy has been used by First Nations storytellers as a tool for social change. On our screens, humour invites audiences to engage with stories and prompts them to grapple with ideas that they otherwise might shy away from.

results.description: Kiki and Kitty follows the adventures of a young, black woman in a big, white world, where her vagina is a big, black woman AND her best friend.
description_for_label: Kiki and Kitty follows the adventures of a young, black woman in a big, white world, where her vagina is a big, black woman AND her best friend.

results.title: Kiki's Delivery Service
results.brief_description: A young witch, on her mandatory year of independent life, finds fitting into a new community difficult while she supports herself by running an air courier service.
results.description: A young witch, on her mandatory year of independent life, finds fitting into a new community difficult while she supports herself by running an air courier service.

results.title: Kika
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, Esther Garcia, Agustin Almodovar and Ciby
results.brief_description: An intriguing web of desire, deceit and death are expertly woven together in this effervescent satire by the unrepentantly twisted director Pedro Almodovar. The madness begins with motormouth make-up artist Kika (Veronique Forque) being summoned to the home of ex-pat American writer Nicholas (Peter Coyote) to make over the corpse of his step-son, Ramon (Alex Casanovas). During her ministrations, Ramon awakens from a cataleptic trance, and the pair fall in love. Complicating their bizarre relationship further are Kika’s sporadic involvement with Nicholas, the lustful adoration of her maid, Juana (Rossy de Palma), and Ramon’s demented ex-girlfriend, Andrea Scarface (Victoria Abril), the host of the voyeuristic reality television show, `Today’s Worst’. Committed to turning private lives inside out for a scoop, Andrea zips around Madrid on a motorcycle with a camera strapped to her crash helmet. Things truly take a turn for the outrageous when Juana’s psychotic ex-porn star brother, Pablo, appears on the scene after breaking out of jail, with Andrea hot on his heels. An explicit but entertaining film filled with fabulous imagery and dazzling costumes from famous fashion designers Jean Paul Gaultier and Gianni Versace. Veronique Forque won a Goya Award for Best Lead Actress for her portrayal of Kika. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Kiewa catchment farm tree group: a community in action
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs. North Central Media Unit
results.brief_description: The Kiewa community formed a tree planting group to combat the problems of land degradation due to the impact of agricultural practices, the effect of tourisism in the area and erosion. This video shows how a small community in the alpine area of north-east Victoria, worked together to deal with an environmental problem.
